```python
from vpython import *

# Screen settings
scene = canvas(width=700, height=400)

# Parameters
g = 9.81  # acceleration due to gravity (m/s^2)
ball_radius = 0.5
initial_height = 5.0  # initial height of the ball
initial_velocity = 10.0  # initial horizontal velocity of the ball

# Ground
ground = box(pos=vector(0, -ball_radius, 0), size=vector(20, 0.1, 10), color=color.green)

# Ball
ball = sphere(pos=vector(0, initial_height, 0), radius=ball_radius, color=color.red, make_trail=True)

# Initial conditions
ball.velocity = vector(initial_velocity, 0, 0)
t = 0
dt = 0.01

# Animation loop
while True:
    rate(100)
    
    ball.pos.x += ball.velocity.x * dt
    ball.velocity.y -= g * dt
    ball.pos.y += ball.velocity.y * dt
    
    if ball.pos.y <= ball_radius:
        ball.velocity.y *= -1
```

The ball is launched horizontally from a specified initial height and velocity, and it bounces elastically upon hitting the ground. Gravity is the only force considered in this simulation. The animation will run continuously, showing the motion of the ball.
